# Tasks: ANSI Common Lisp Numeric Functions

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/001-ansi-numeric-functions/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md, spec.md, research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: TDD is mandated by Constitution Principle VII. Tests are written first and must fail before implementation.

**Organization**: Tasks grouped by user story for independent implementation and testing.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`

- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story (US1-US5) this task belongs to
- File paths are relative to repository root

---

## Phase 1: Setup

**Purpose**: Verify existing infrastructure and prepare for new development

- [ ] T001 Verify existing FFI math imports in src/clysm/ffi/import-gen.lisp
- [ ] T002 [P] Verify host-shim/math-shim.js exports all required functions
- [ ] T003 [P] Run existing numeric tests to establish baseline in tests/unit/

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Define $complex type and predicates needed by multiple user stories

**CRITICAL**: No user story with complex number support can begin until this phase completes

- [ ] T004 Define $complex WasmGC struct type (index 9) in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/gc-types.lisp
- [ ] T005 Add complexp type predicate codegen in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T006 [P] Add realp type predicate codegen in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T007 [P] Extend numberp to include complex in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T008 Create type coercion helper for real-to-f64 extraction in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T009 Create complex-from-reals constructor helper in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - $complex type and predicates available for all user stories

---

## Phase 3: User Story 2 - Bitwise Integer Operations (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: Implement bitwise operations (ash, logand, logior, logxor, lognot, logcount) using native Wasm i32 instructions

**Independent Test**: `(logand #b1100 #b1010)` => 8, `(ash 1 10)` => 1024, `(logcount 255)` => 8

**Why US2 first**: No complex number dependencies, pure integer operations with zero FFI overhead

### Tests for User Story 2

- [ ] T010 [P] [US2] Test logand with 0, 1, 2+ args in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T011 [P] [US2] Test logior with 0, 1, 2+ args in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T012 [P] [US2] Test logxor with 0, 1, 2+ args in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T013 [P] [US2] Test lognot with positive and negative integers in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T014 [P] [US2] Test ash with positive and negative shift counts in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T015 [P] [US2] Test logcount with positive and negative integers in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T016 [US2] Add compile-logand with identity -1 for no args in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T017 [P] [US2] Add compile-logior with identity 0 for no args in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T018 [P] [US2] Add compile-logxor with identity 0 for no args in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T019 [US2] Add compile-lognot using i32.xor with -1 in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T020 [US2] Add compile-ash with i32.shl/i32.shr_s dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T021 [US2] Add compile-logcount using i32.popcnt in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T022 [US2] Register bitwise functions in builtin dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Bitwise operations fully functional - run tests to verify

---

## Phase 4: User Story 3 - Mathematical Functions (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: Implement abs, signum, max, min, gcd, lcm, sqrt, exp, log, expt

**Independent Test**: `(abs -5)` => 5, `(gcd 48 18)` => 6, `(sqrt 4)` => 2.0, `(expt 2 10)` => 1024

### Tests for User Story 3

- [ ] T023 [P] [US3] Test abs for integers, floats, and complex in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T024 [P] [US3] Test signum for integers, floats, zero, and complex in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T025 [P] [US3] Test max/min with multiple args and mixed types in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T026 [P] [US3] Test gcd with 0, 1, 2+ args and edge cases in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T027 [P] [US3] Test lcm with 0, 1, 2+ args and edge cases in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T028 [P] [US3] Test sqrt for positive, zero, and negative inputs in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T029 [P] [US3] Test expt including (expt 0 0) => 1 in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 3

- [ ] T030 [US3] Add compile-abs for integer and float types in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T031 [US3] Add compile-signum for integer and float types in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T032 [US3] Add compile-max with &rest real arguments in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T033 [P] [US3] Add compile-min with &rest real arguments in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T034 [US3] Add compile-gcd with Euclidean algorithm in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T035 [US3] Add compile-lcm using gcd in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T036 [US3] Add compile-sqrt with complex output for negative in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T037 [US3] Add compile-expt using existing pow FFI in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T038 [US3] Extend compile-abs for complex magnitude in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T039 [US3] Extend compile-signum for complex normalization in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T040 [US3] Register math functions in builtin dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Mathematical functions complete - sqrt returns complex for negative inputs

---

## Phase 5: User Story 1 - Trigonometric Functions (Priority: P1)

**Goal**: Complete sin/cos/tan (already partial), add asin/acos/atan with complex output

**Independent Test**: `(sin 0.5)` => 0.479..., `(atan 1 1)` => Ï€/4, `(asin 2)` => complex

**Note**: Basic sin/cos/tan already implemented. Focus on completing asin/acos and two-arg atan.

### Tests for User Story 1

- [ ] T041 [P] [US1] Test sin/cos/tan with various inputs in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T042 [P] [US1] Test asin with values in [-1,1] and out-of-domain in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T043 [P] [US1] Test acos with values in [-1,1] and out-of-domain in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T044 [P] [US1] Test atan with 1 and 2 arguments in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T045 [US1] Verify existing compile-sin works correctly in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T046 [P] [US1] Verify existing compile-cos works correctly in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T047 [P] [US1] Verify existing compile-tan works correctly in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T048 [US1] Extend compile-asin for complex output when |x|>1 in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T049 [US1] Extend compile-acos for complex output when |x|>1 in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T050 [US1] Verify compile-atan handles 1-arg and 2-arg cases in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Trigonometric functions complete - asin/acos return complex for out-of-domain

---

## Phase 6: User Story 4 - Hyperbolic Functions (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Complete sinh/cosh/tanh (already via FFI), add asinh/acosh/atanh with complex output

**Independent Test**: `(sinh 0)` => 0.0, `(cosh 0)` => 1.0, `(acosh 0.5)` => complex

### Tests for User Story 4

- [ ] T051 [P] [US4] Test sinh/cosh/tanh basic values in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T052 [P] [US4] Test asinh with various inputs in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T053 [P] [US4] Test acosh with x>=1 and x<1 in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T054 [P] [US4] Test atanh with |x|<1 and |x|>=1 in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 4

- [ ] T055 [US4] Verify existing compile-sinh works correctly in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T056 [P] [US4] Verify existing compile-cosh works correctly in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T057 [P] [US4] Verify existing compile-tanh works correctly in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T058 [US4] Verify compile-asinh works correctly in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T059 [US4] Extend compile-acosh for complex output when x<1 in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T060 [US4] Extend compile-atanh for complex output when |x|>=1 in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Hyperbolic functions complete - inverse functions return complex for domain errors

---

## Phase 7: User Story 5 - Complex Number Operations (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: Implement complex constructor, realpart, imagpart, conjugate, phase

**Independent Test**: `(complex 3 4)` => #C(3 4), `(realpart #C(3 4))` => 3, `(phase #C(0 1))` => Ï€/2

### Tests for User Story 5

- [ ] T061 [P] [US5] Test complex constructor with various inputs in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T062 [P] [US5] Test realpart with complex and real inputs in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T063 [P] [US5] Test imagpart with complex and real inputs in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T064 [P] [US5] Test conjugate with complex and real inputs in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T065 [P] [US5] Test phase with various complex inputs in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp

### Implementation for User Story 5

- [ ] T066 [US5] Add compile-complex constructor in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T067 [US5] Add compile-realpart with type dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T068 [P] [US5] Add compile-imagpart with type dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T069 [US5] Add compile-conjugate for complex and identity for reals in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T070 [US5] Add compile-phase using atan2 FFI in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp
- [ ] T071 [US5] Register complex functions in builtin dispatch in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp

**Checkpoint**: Complex number operations complete - all 5 functions working

---

## Phase 8: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Final integration, compliance testing, documentation

- [ ] T072 Run ANSI numbers category compliance tests in tests/ansi/
- [ ] T073 Calculate and verify 50%+ compliance rate for SC-001
- [ ] T074 [P] Add edge case tests for IEEE 754 special values in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp
- [ ] T075 [P] Update exports in clysm.asd for new functions
- [ ] T076 Validate quickstart.md examples work in specs/001-ansi-numeric-functions/quickstart.md
- [ ] T077 [P] Add docstrings to all new compile-* functions in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - verify existing infrastructure
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup - BLOCKS stories needing complex type
- **US2 Bitwise (Phase 3)**: Depends on Setup only (no complex needed)
- **US3 Math (Phase 4)**: Depends on Foundational (abs for complex)
- **US1 Trig (Phase 5)**: Depends on Foundational (asin/acos complex output)
- **US4 Hyperbolic (Phase 6)**: Depends on Foundational (acosh/atanh complex output)
- **US5 Complex (Phase 7)**: Depends on Foundational (uses $complex type)
- **Polish (Phase 8)**: Depends on all user stories complete

### User Story Dependencies

| Story | Priority | Depends On | Can Parallel With |
|-------|----------|------------|-------------------|
| US2 (Bitwise) | P1 | Setup only | US3, US1, US4 |
| US3 (Math) | P1 | Foundational | US2, US1, US4, US5 |
| US1 (Trig) | P1 | Foundational | US2, US3, US4, US5 |
| US4 (Hyperbolic) | P2 | Foundational | US2, US3, US1, US5 |
| US5 (Complex) | P2 | Foundational | US2, US3, US1, US4 |

### Parallel Opportunities

**Within each user story, tasks marked [P] can run in parallel:**

- All test tasks [P] [USn] can run together
- Model/type tasks marked [P] can run together
- Verification tasks marked [P] can run together

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 2

```bash
# Launch all US2 tests in parallel:
Task: "Test logand with 0, 1, 2+ args in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp"
Task: "Test logior with 0, 1, 2+ args in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp"
Task: "Test logxor with 0, 1, 2+ args in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp"
Task: "Test lognot with positive and negative integers in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp"
Task: "Test ash with positive and negative shift counts in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp"
Task: "Test logcount with positive and negative integers in tests/unit/numeric-test.lisp"

# Then launch parallel implementations:
Task: "Add compile-logior with identity 0 in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp"
Task: "Add compile-logxor with identity 0 in src/clysm/compiler/codegen/func-section.lisp"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 2 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup (T001-T003)
2. Skip Phase 2 (no complex needed for US2)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 2 - Bitwise (T010-T022)
4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Run bitwise tests independently
5. Delivers: logand, logior, logxor, lognot, ash, logcount

### Recommended Order

1. **Week 1**: Setup + Foundational + US2 (Bitwise)
   - MVP increment: All bitwise operations working
2. **Week 2**: US3 (Mathematical Functions)
   - Increment: abs, signum, max, min, gcd, lcm, sqrt, expt
3. **Week 3**: US1 (Trigonometric) + US4 (Hyperbolic)
   - Increment: Complete transcendental functions with complex support
4. **Week 4**: US5 (Complex Operations) + Polish
   - Increment: Full complex number support, 50%+ compliance

### Incremental Delivery

Each user story adds independently testable value:

1. US2 â†’ Low-level programming, cryptography use cases
2. US3 â†’ Scientific computing, general math
3. US1 â†’ Scientific computing, graphics
4. US4 â†’ Engineering applications
5. US5 â†’ Full ANSI complex number compliance

---

## Task Summary

| Phase | Description | Tasks | Parallel |
|-------|-------------|-------|----------|
| 1 | Setup | 3 | 2 |
| 2 | Foundational | 6 | 2 |
| 3 | US2: Bitwise | 13 | 9 |
| 4 | US3: Math | 18 | 9 |
| 5 | US1: Trig | 10 | 6 |
| 6 | US4: Hyperbolic | 10 | 6 |
| 7 | US5: Complex | 11 | 7 |
| 8 | Polish | 6 | 3 |
| **Total** | | **77** | **44** |

---

## Notes

- TDD mandated by Constitution VII: Tests MUST fail before implementation
- [P] tasks can run in parallel within their phase
- Each user story is independently testable after completion
- Complex type (Phase 2) is required before any complex-returning function
- Commit after each logical group of tasks
- Target: 50%+ ANSI numbers category compliance (SC-001)

1â†’# Implementation Plan: ANSI Common Lisp Numeric Functions
     2â†’
     3â†’**Branch**: `001-ansi-numeric-functions` | **Date**: 2025-12-29 | **Spec**: [spec.md](./spec.md)
     4â†’**Input**: Feature specification from `/specs/001-ansi-numeric-functions/spec.md`
     5â†’
     6â†’## Summary
     7â†’
     8â†’Implement ANSI Common Lisp numeric functions for the clysm compiler targeting 50%+ numbers category test compliance. This includes trigonometric functions (sin/cos/tan/asin/acos/atan), hyperbolic functions (sinh/cosh/tanh/asinh/acosh/atanh), bitwise operations (ash/logand/logior/logxor/lognot/logcount), complex number operations (complex/realpart/imagpart/conjugate/phase), and mathematical functions (exp/log/sqrt/expt/abs/signum/max/min/gcd/lcm).
     9â†’
    10â†’Technical approach: Leverage existing FFI infrastructure to call JavaScript Math functions for transcendental operations. Implement integer-only operations (bitwise, gcd/lcm) directly in Wasm codegen. Add complex number type representation using WasmGC structs.
    11â†’
    12â†’## Technical Context
    13â†’
    14â†’**Language/Version**: Common Lisp (SBCL 2.4+) for host compiler, WasmGC for target
    15â†’**Primary Dependencies**: alexandria, babel (UTF-8), wasmtime, wasm-tools
    16â†’**Storage**: N/A (in-memory compilation only)
    17â†’**Testing**: Rove (unit tests), ANSI CL test suite (compliance), wasm-tools validate
    18â†’**Target Platform**: WasmGC (WebAssembly with GC proposal), Node.js host
    19â†’**Project Type**: Single project (compiler + runtime)
    20â†’**Performance Goals**: Per Constitution - Fixnum arithmetic 1.5x native, function call <5ns
    21â†’**Constraints**: WasmGC type hierarchy, no linear memory, FFI for transcendental functions
    22â†’**Scale/Scope**: 35 functions across 5 categories, targeting 50%+ ANSI numbers test compliance
    23â†’
    24â†’## Constitution Check
    25â†’
    26â†’*GATE: Must pass before Phase 0 research. Re-check after Phase 1 design.*
    27â†’
    28â†’| Principle | Status | Notes |
    29â†’|-----------|--------|-------|
    30â†’| I. WasmGC-First Type System | PASS | Complex numbers will use WasmGC struct type |
    31â†’| II. Lisp Object Representation | PASS | Numeric types follow established Float/Integer representation |
    32â†’| III. Function/Closure Strategy | PASS | Numeric functions are regular closures |
    33â†’| IV. Wasm Control Flow | PASS | No special control flow requirements |
    34â†’| V. Shallow Binding | N/A | No dynamic scope in numeric functions |
    35â†’| VI. Tiered Eval/JIT | PASS | Functions available in both interpreter and compiled code |
    36â†’| VII. TDD (Non-Negotiable) | PASS | Tests written first per Rove framework |
    37â†’| VIII. Nix-First Workflow | PASS | Using existing flake.nix development environment |
    38â†’
    39â†’**Gate Result**: PASS - All constitution principles satisfied.
    40â†’
    41â†’## Project Structure
    42â†’
    43â†’### Documentation (this feature)
    44â†’
    45â†’```text
    46â†’specs/001-ansi-numeric-functions/
    47â†’â”œâ”€â”€ plan.md              # This file
    48â†’â”œâ”€â”€ research.md          # Phase 0 output
    49â†’â”œâ”€â”€ data-model.md        # Phase 1 output
    50â†’â”œâ”€â”€ quickstart.md        # Phase 1 output
    51â†’â”œâ”€â”€ contracts/           # Phase 1 output
    52â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ numeric-api.lisp # Function contracts
    53â†’â””â”€â”€ tasks.md             # Phase 2 output (/speckit.tasks)
    54â†’```
    55â†’
    56â†’### Source Code (repository root)
    57â†’
    58â†’```text
    59â†’src/clysm/
    60â†’â”œâ”€â”€ compiler/
    61â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ codegen/
    62â†’â”‚       â””â”€â”€ func-section.lisp    # Add numeric function codegen
    63â†’â”œâ”€â”€ ffi/
    64â†’â”‚   â””â”€â”€ import-gen.lisp          # Extend math imports

    68â†’â”œâ”€â”€ runtime/

    70â†’â””â”€â”€ ansi-test/

    72â†’
    73â†’host-shim/
    74â†’â””â”€â”€ math-shim.js                 # Extend with abs, signum (if needed)
    75â†’
    76â†’tests/

# Implementation Plan: ANSI Common Lisp Numeric Functions

**Branch**: `001-ansi-numeric-functions` | **Date**: 2025-12-29 | **Spec**: [spec.md](./spec.md)
**Input**: Feature specification from `/specs/001-ansi-numeric-functions/spec.md`

## Summary

Implement ANSI Common Lisp numeric functions for the clysm compiler targeting 50%+ numbers category test compliance. This includes trigonometric functions (sin/cos/tan/asin/acos/atan), hyperbolic functions (sinh/cosh/tanh/asinh/acosh/atanh), bitwise operations (ash/logand/logior/logxor/lognot/logcount), complex number operations (complex/realpart/imagpart/conjugate/phase), and mathematical functions (exp/log/sqrt/expt/abs/signum/max/min/gcd/lcm).

Technical approach: Leverage existing FFI infrastructure to call JavaScript Math functions for transcendental operations. Implement integer-only operations (bitwise, gcd/lcm) directly in Wasm codegen. Add complex number type representation using WasmGC structs.

## Technical Context

**Language/Version**: Common Lisp (SBCL 2.4+) for host compiler, WasmGC for target
**Primary Dependencies**: alexandria, babel (UTF-8), wasmtime, wasm-tools
**Storage**: N/A (in-memory compilation only)
**Testing**: Rove (unit tests), ANSI CL test suite (compliance), wasm-tools validate
**Target Platform**: WasmGC (WebAssembly with GC proposal), Node.js host
**Project Type**: Single project (compiler + runtime)
**Performance Goals**: Per Constitution - Fixnum arithmetic 1.5x native, function call <5ns
**Constraints**: WasmGC type hierarchy, no linear memory, FFI for transcendental functions
**Scale/Scope**: 35 functions across 5 categories, targeting 50%+ ANSI numbers test compliance

## Constitution Check

*GATE: Must pass before Phase 0 research. Re-check after Phase 1 design.*

| Principle | Status | Notes |
|-----------|--------|-------|
| I. WasmGC-First Type System | PASS | Complex numbers will use WasmGC struct type |
| II. Lisp Object Representation | PASS | Numeric types follow established Float/Integer representation |
| III. Function/Closure Strategy | PASS | Numeric functions are regular closures |
| IV. Wasm Control Flow | PASS | No special control flow requirements |
| V. Shallow Binding | N/A | No dynamic scope in numeric functions |
| VI. Tiered Eval/JIT | PASS | Functions available in both interpreter and compiled code |
| VII. TDD (Non-Negotiable) | PASS | Tests written first per Rove framework |
| VIII. Nix-First Workflow | PASS | Using existing flake.nix development environment |

**Gate Result**: PASS - All constitution principles satisfied.

## Project Structure

### Documentation (this feature)

```text
specs/001-ansi-numeric-functions/
â”œâ”€â”€ plan.md              # This file
â”œâ”€â”€ research.md          # Phase 0 output
â”œâ”€â”€ data-model.md        # Phase 1 output
â”œâ”€â”€ quickstart.md        # Phase 1 output
â”œâ”€â”€ contracts/           # Phase 1 output
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ numeric-api.lisp # Function contracts
â””â”€â”€ tasks.md             # Phase 2 output (/speckit.tasks)
```

### Source Code (repository root)

```text
src/clysm/
â”œâ”€â”€ compiler/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ codegen/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ func-section.lisp    # Add numeric function codegen
â”œâ”€â”€ ffi/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ import-gen.lisp          # Extend math imports
â”œâ”€â”€ lib/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ macros.lisp              # Add signum, abs variants
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ numeric.lisp             # NEW: Numeric function implementations
â”œâ”€â”€ runtime/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ complex.lisp             # NEW: Complex number type support
â””â”€â”€ ansi-test/
    â””â”€â”€ numbers-test.lisp        # NEW: ANSI numbers category tests

host-shim/
â””â”€â”€ math-shim.js                 # Extend with abs, signum (if needed)

tests/
â”œâ”€â”€ unit/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ numeric-test.lisp        # Unit tests for numeric functions
â””â”€â”€ contract/
    â””â”€â”€ numeric-contract-test.lisp  # Contract tests
```

**Structure Decision**: Single project structure. New files for complex number support and numeric function implementations. Extends existing FFI infrastructure (import-gen.lisp, math-shim.js).

## Complexity Tracking

No constitution violations. All implementations follow established patterns.

| Aspect | Approach | Justification |
|--------|----------|---------------|
| Transcendental functions | FFI to JS Math | 10x faster than Taylor series in Wasm (per research) |
| Bitwise operations | Wasm i32/i64 ops | Native Wasm instructions, no FFI overhead |
| Complex numbers | WasmGC struct | Follows Constitution I (WasmGC-First) |
| gcd/lcm | Euclidean algorithm | Standard implementation, no dependencies |

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 0: Research Complete

See [research.md](./research.md) for detailed findings on:
- Existing FFI math infrastructure (already implemented for sin/cos/exp/log/sqrt)
- Bitwise operation implementation patterns
- Complex number representation options
- ANSI CL edge case handling

### Phase 1: Design Complete

See [data-model.md](./data-model.md) for:
- Complex number WasmGC type definition
- Function signatures and type coercion rules
- Edge case handling matrix

See [contracts/](./contracts/) for:
- API contracts for all 35 functions
- Type dispatch rules
- Error conditions

### Phase 2: Tasks (Generated by /speckit.tasks)

Task breakdown will be generated in tasks.md.

1â†’;;;; numeric-api.lisp - API Contracts for ANSI Numeric Functions
     2â†’;;;; Feature: 001-ansi-numeric-functions
     3â†’;;;; Date: 2025-12-29
     4â†’
     5â†’(in-package #:clysm/contracts/numeric)
     6â†’
     7â†’;;; ============================================================
     8â†’;;; Trigonometric Functions (FR-001 to FR-006)
     9â†’;;; ============================================================
    10â†’
    11â†’(defcontract sin (x)
    12â†’  "Compute the sine of X (in radians).
    13â†’   FR-001: System MUST implement sin accepting a real number and returning the sine as a float."
    14â†’  :precondition (realp x)
    15â†’  :postcondition (floatp result)
    16â†’  :examples
    17â†’  ((sin 0) => 0.0)
    18â†’  ((sin (/ pi 2)) => 1.0)
    19â†’  ((sin pi) => 0.0))
    20â†’
    21â†’(defcontract cos (x)
    22â†’  "Compute the cosine of X (in radians).
    23â†’   FR-002: System MUST implement cos accepting a real number and returning the cosine as a float."
    24â†’  :precondition (realp x)
    25â†’  :postcondition (floatp result)
    26â†’  :examples
    27â†’  ((cos 0) => 1.0)
    28â†’  ((cos (/ pi 2)) => 0.0)
    29â†’  ((cos pi) => -1.0))
    30â†’
    31â†’(defcontract tan (x)
    32â†’  "Compute the tangent of X (in radians).
    33â†’   FR-003: System MUST implement tan accepting a real number and returning the tangent as a float."
    34â†’  :precondition (realp x)
    35â†’  :postcondition (floatp result)
    36â†’  :examples
    37â†’  ((tan 0) => 0.0)
    38â†’  ((tan (/ pi 4)) => 1.0))
    39â†’
    40â†’(defcontract asin (x)
    41â†’  "Compute the arc sine of X, result in radians.
    42â†’   FR-004: System MUST implement asin accepting a number in [-1, 1] and returning the arc sine in radians.
    43â†’   For |x| > 1, returns complex result per ANSI CL."
    44â†’  :precondition (numberp x)
    45â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
    46â†’  :examples
    47â†’  ((asin 0) => 0.0)
    48â†’  ((asin 1) => (/ pi 2))
    49â†’  ((asin 2) => #C(1.5707963... 1.316957...)))
    50â†’
    51â†’(defcontract acos (x)
    52â†’  "Compute the arc cosine of X, result in radians.
    53â†’   FR-005: System MUST implement acos accepting a number in [-1, 1] and returning the arc cosine in radians.
    54â†’   For |x| > 1, returns complex result per ANSI CL."
    55â†’  :precondition (numberp x)
    56â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
    57â†’  :examples
    58â†’  ((acos 1) => 0.0)
    59â†’  ((acos 0) => (/ pi 2))
    60â†’  ((acos -1) => pi))
    61â†’
    62â†’(defcontract atan (y &optional x)
    63â†’  "Compute the arc tangent.
    64â†’   FR-006: System MUST implement atan accepting one or two arguments and returning the arc tangent in radians.
    65â†’   With one arg: atan(y).
    66â†’   With two args: atan2(y, x) for correct quadrant."
    67â†’  :precondition (and (realp y) (or (null x) (realp x)))
    68â†’  :postcondition (floatp result)
    69â†’  :examples
    70â†’  ((atan 0) => 0.0)
    71â†’  ((atan 1) => (/ pi 4))
    72â†’  ((atan 1 1) => (/ pi 4))
    73â†’  ((atan 1 -1) => (* 3 (/ pi 4))))
    74â†’
    75â†’;;; ============================================================
    76â†’;;; Hyperbolic Functions (FR-007 to FR-012)
    77â†’;;; ============================================================
    78â†’
    79â†’(defcontract sinh (x)
    80â†’  "Compute the hyperbolic sine of X.
    81â†’   FR-007: System MUST implement sinh accepting a real number and returning the hyperbolic sine."
    82â†’  :precondition (realp x)
    83â†’  :postcondition (floatp result)
    84â†’  :examples
    85â†’  ((sinh 0) => 0.0))
    86â†’
    87â†’(defcontract cosh (x)
    88â†’  "Compute the hyperbolic cosine of X.
    89â†’   FR-008: System MUST implement cosh accepting a real number and returning the hyperbolic cosine."
    90â†’  :precondition (realp x)
    91â†’  :postcondition (floatp result)
    92â†’  :examples
    93â†’  ((cosh 0) => 1.0))
    94â†’
    95â†’(defcontract tanh (x)
    96â†’  "Compute the hyperbolic tangent of X.
    97â†’   FR-009: System MUST implement tanh accepting a real number and returning the hyperbolic tangent."
    98â†’  :precondition (realp x)
    99â†’  :postcondition (floatp result)
   100â†’  :examples
   101â†’  ((tanh 0) => 0.0))
   102â†’
   103â†’(defcontract asinh (x)
   104â†’  "Compute the inverse hyperbolic sine of X.
   105â†’   FR-010: System MUST implement asinh accepting a real number and returning the inverse hyperbolic sine."
   106â†’  :precondition (realp x)
   107â†’  :postcondition (floatp result)
   108â†’  :examples
   109â†’  ((asinh 0) => 0.0))
   110â†’
   111â†’(defcontract acosh (x)
   112â†’  "Compute the inverse hyperbolic cosine of X.
   113â†’   FR-011: System MUST implement acosh accepting a number >= 1 and returning the inverse hyperbolic cosine.
   114â†’   For x < 1, returns complex result."
   115â†’  :precondition (numberp x)
   116â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
   117â†’  :examples
   118â†’  ((acosh 1) => 0.0))
   119â†’
   120â†’(defcontract atanh (x)
   121â†’  "Compute the inverse hyperbolic tangent of X.
   122â†’   FR-012: System MUST implement atanh accepting a number in (-1, 1) and returning the inverse hyperbolic tangent.
   123â†’   For |x| >= 1, returns complex result."
   124â†’  :precondition (numberp x)
   125â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
   126â†’  :examples
   127â†’  ((atanh 0) => 0.0))
   128â†’
   129â†’;;; ============================================================
   130â†’;;; Bitwise Operations (FR-013 to FR-018)
   131â†’;;; ============================================================
   132â†’
   133â†’(defcontract ash (integer count)
   134â†’  "Arithmetic shift INTEGER by COUNT bits.
   135â†’   FR-013: System MUST implement ash accepting an integer and shift count, returning the arithmetic-shifted result.
   136â†’   Positive count: shift left. Negative count: shift right (sign-extending)."
   137â†’  :precondition (and (integerp integer) (integerp count))
   138â†’  :postcondition (integerp result)
   139â†’  :examples
   140â†’  ((ash 1 4) => 16)
   141â†’  ((ash 16 -2) => 4)
   142â†’  ((ash -16 -2) => -4))
   143â†’
   144â†’(defcontract logand (&rest integers)
   145â†’  "Bitwise AND of INTEGERS.
   146â†’   FR-014: System MUST implement logand accepting zero or more integers, returning the bitwise AND (identity -1 for no args)."
   147â†’  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
   148â†’  :postcondition (integerp result)
   149â†’  :examples
   150â†’  ((logand) => -1)
   151â†’  ((logand #b1100 #b1010) => #b1000)
   152â†’  ((logand #xFFFF #x0F0F) => #x0F0F))
   153â†’
   154â†’(defcontract logior (&rest integers)
   155â†’  "Bitwise inclusive OR of INTEGERS.
   156â†’   FR-015: System MUST implement logior accepting zero or more integers, returning the bitwise inclusive OR (identity 0 for no args)."
   157â†’  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
   158â†’  :postcondition (integerp result)
   159â†’  :examples
   160â†’  ((logior) => 0)
   161â†’  ((logior #b1100 #b1010) => #b1110)
   162â†’  ((logior #x0F00 #x00F0) => #x0FF0))
   163â†’
   164â†’(defcontract logxor (&rest integers)
   165â†’  "Bitwise exclusive OR of INTEGERS.
   166â†’   FR-016: System MUST implement logxor accepting zero or more integers, returning the bitwise exclusive OR (identity 0 for no args)."
   167â†’  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
   168â†’  :postcondition (integerp result)
   169â†’  :examples
   170â†’  ((logxor) => 0)
   171â†’  ((logxor #b1100 #b1010) => #b0110)
   172â†’  ((logxor #xFFFF #x0F0F) => #xF0F0))
   173â†’
   174â†’(defcontract lognot (integer)
   175â†’  "Bitwise complement of INTEGER.
   176â†’   FR-017: System MUST implement lognot accepting an integer, returning the bitwise complement."
   177â†’  :precondition (integerp integer)
   178â†’  :postcondition (integerp result)
   179â†’  :examples
   180â†’  ((lognot 0) => -1)
   181â†’  ((lognot -1) => 0)
   182â†’  ((lognot #b0101) => #b...11111010))
   183â†’
   184â†’(defcontract logcount (integer)
   185â†’  "Count bits in INTEGER.
   186â†’   FR-018: System MUST implement logcount accepting an integer, returning the count of 1-bits (positive) or 0-bits (negative)."
   187â†’  :precondition (integerp integer)
   188â†’  :postcondition (and (integerp result) (>= result 0))
   189â†’  :examples
   190â†’  ((logcount 0) => 0)
   191â†’  ((logcount #b1011) => 3)
   192â†’  ((logcount 255) => 8)
   193â†’  ((logcount -1) => 0))
   194â†’
   195â†’;;; ============================================================
   196â†’;;; Complex Number Operations (FR-019 to FR-023)
   197â†’;;; ============================================================
   198â†’
   199â†’(defcontract complex (realpart &optional (imagpart 0))
   200â†’  "Create a complex number.
   201â†’   FR-019: System MUST implement complex accepting two real numbers and returning a complex number."
   202â†’  :precondition (and (realp realpart) (realp imagpart))
   203â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
   204â†’  :examples
   205â†’  ((complex 3 4) => #C(3 4))
   206â†’  ((complex 5) => 5)
   207â†’  ((complex 0 1) => #C(0 1)))
   208â†’
   209â†’(defcontract realpart (number)
   210â†’  "Extract the real part of NUMBER.
   211â†’   FR-020: System MUST implement realpart accepting a number and returning the real component."
   212â†’  :precondition (numberp number)
   213â†’  :postcondition (realp result)
   214â†’  :examples
   215â†’  ((realpart #C(3 4)) => 3)
   216â†’  ((realpart 5) => 5)
   217â†’  ((realpart 3.5) => 3.5))
   218â†’
   219â†’(defcontract imagpart (number)
   220â†’  "Extract the imaginary part of NUMBER.
   221â†’   FR-021: System MUST implement imagpart accepting a number and returning the imaginary component (0 for reals)."
   222â†’  :precondition (numberp number)
   223â†’  :postcondition (realp result)
   224â†’  :examples
   225â†’  ((imagpart #C(3 4)) => 4)
   226â†’  ((imagpart 5) => 0)
   227â†’  ((imagpart 3.5) => 0))
   228â†’
   229â†’(defcontract conjugate (number)
   230â†’  "Return the complex conjugate of NUMBER.
   231â†’   FR-022: System MUST implement conjugate accepting a number and returning the complex conjugate."
   232â†’  :precondition (numberp number)
   233â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
   234â†’  :examples
   235â†’  ((conjugate #C(3 4)) => #C(3 -4))
   236â†’  ((conjugate 5) => 5)
   237â†’  ((conjugate #C(0 1)) => #C(0 -1)))
   238â†’
   239â†’(defcontract phase (number)
   240â†’  "Return the phase angle of NUMBER in radians.
   241â†’   FR-023: System MUST implement phase accepting a number and returning the angle in radians."
   242â†’  :precondition (numberp number)
   243â†’  :postcondition (floatp result)
   244â†’  :examples
   245â†’  ((phase 1) => 0.0)
   246â†’  ((phase -1) => pi)
   247â†’  ((phase #C(0 1)) => (/ pi 2))
   248â†’  ((phase #C(1 1)) => (/ pi 4)))
   249â†’
   250â†’;;; ============================================================
   251â†’;;; Mathematical Functions (FR-024 to FR-033)
   252â†’;;; ============================================================
   253â†’
   254â†’(defcontract exp (number)
   255â†’  "Compute e raised to the power NUMBER.
   256â†’   FR-024: System MUST implement exp accepting a number and returning e raised to that power."
   257â†’  :precondition (numberp number)
   258â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
   259â†’  :examples
   260â†’  ((exp 0) => 1.0)
   261â†’  ((exp 1) => 2.718281828...))
   262â†’
   263â†’(defcontract log (number &optional base)
   264â†’  "Compute the logarithm of NUMBER.
   265â†’   FR-025: System MUST implement log accepting one or two arguments (number and optional base), returning the logarithm."
   266â†’  :precondition (and (numberp number) (or (null base) (realp base)))
   267â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
   268â†’  :examples
   269â†’  ((log 1) => 0.0)
   270â†’  ((log (exp 1)) => 1.0)
   271â†’  ((log 100 10) => 2.0)
   272â†’  ((log -1) => #C(0 pi)))
   273â†’
   274â†’(defcontract sqrt (number)
   275â†’  "Compute the principal square root of NUMBER.
   276â†’   FR-026: System MUST implement sqrt accepting a number and returning the principal square root."
   277â†’  :precondition (numberp number)
   278â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
   279â†’  :examples
   280â†’  ((sqrt 4) => 2.0)
   281â†’  ((sqrt 2) => 1.4142135...)
   282â†’  ((sqrt -1) => #C(0 1)))
   283â†’
   284â†’(defcontract expt (base power)
   285â†’  "Compute BASE raised to the POWER.
   286â†’   FR-027: System MUST implement expt accepting a base and exponent, returning the power."
   287â†’  :precondition (and (numberp base) (numberp power))
   288â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
   289â†’  :examples
   290â†’  ((expt 2 10) => 1024)
   291â†’  ((expt 2 0.5) => 1.4142135...)
   292â†’  ((expt 0 0) => 1))
   293â†’
   294â†’(defcontract abs (number)
   295â†’  "Compute the absolute value (magnitude for complex) of NUMBER.
   296â†’   FR-028: System MUST implement abs accepting a number and returning the absolute value."
   297â†’  :precondition (numberp number)
   298â†’  :postcondition (and (realp result) (>= result 0))
   299â†’  :examples
   300â†’  ((abs 5) => 5)
   301â†’  ((abs -5) => 5)
   302â†’  ((abs -3.5) => 3.5)
   303â†’  ((abs #C(3 4)) => 5.0))
   304â†’
   305â†’(defcontract signum (number)
   306â†’  "Return the sign indicator of NUMBER.
   307â†’   FR-029: System MUST implement signum accepting a number and returning the sign indicator."
   308â†’  :precondition (numberp number)
   309â†’  :postcondition (numberp result)
   310â†’  :examples
   311â†’  ((signum 5) => 1)
   312â†’  ((signum -5) => -1)
   313â†’  ((signum 0) => 0)
   314â†’  ((signum 3.5) => 1.0)
   315â†’  ((signum #C(3 4)) => #C(0.6 0.8)))
   316â†’
   317â†’(defcontract max (&rest reals)
   318â†’  "Return the largest of REALS.
   319â†’   FR-030: System MUST implement max accepting one or more real numbers, returning the largest."
   320â†’  :precondition (and (>= (length reals) 1) (every #'realp reals))
   321â†’  :postcondition (realp result)
   322â†’  :examples
   323â†’  ((max 1 2 3) => 3)
   324â†’  ((max -5 -3 -7) => -3)
   325â†’  ((max 1.5 2 0.5) => 2))
   326â†’
   327â†’(defcontract min (&rest reals)
   328â†’  "Return the smallest of REALS.
   329â†’   FR-031: System MUST implement min accepting one or more real numbers, returning the smallest."
   330â†’  :precondition (and (>= (length reals) 1) (every #'realp reals))
   331â†’  :postcondition (realp result)
   332â†’  :examples
   333â†’  ((min 1 2 3) => 1)
   334â†’  ((min -5 -3 -7) => -7)
   335â†’  ((min 1.5 2 0.5) => 0.5))
   336â†’
   337â†’(defcontract gcd (&rest integers)
   338â†’  "Compute the greatest common divisor of INTEGERS.
   339â†’   FR-032: System MUST implement gcd accepting zero or more non-negative integers, returning the GCD."
   340â†’  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
   341â†’  :postcondition (and (integerp result) (>= result 0))
   342â†’  :examples
   343â†’  ((gcd) => 0)
   344â†’  ((gcd 48 18) => 6)
   345â†’  ((gcd 12 18 24) => 6)
   346â†’  ((gcd 0 5) => 5))
   347â†’
   348â†’(defcontract lcm (&rest integers)
   349â†’  "Compute the least common multiple of INTEGERS.
   350â†’   FR-033: System MUST implement lcm accepting zero or more non-negative integers, returning the LCM."
   351â†’  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
   352â†’  :postcondition (and (integerp result) (>= result 0))
   353â†’  :examples
   354â†’  ((lcm) => 1)
   355â†’  ((lcm 4 6) => 12)
   356â†’  ((lcm 2 3 4) => 12)
   357â†’  ((lcm 0 5) => 0))
   358â†’
   359â†’;;; ============================================================
   360â†’;;; FFI Integration (FR-034 to FR-035)
   361â†’;;; ============================================================
   362â†’
   363â†’(defcontract ffi-math-import (name)
   364â†’  "Ensure math function is imported via FFI.
   365â†’   FR-034: System MUST utilize Wasm imports (via host FFI) for standard math operations."
   366â†’  :precondition (member name '(:sin :cos :tan :asin :acos :atan :atan2
   367â†’                               :sinh :cosh :tanh :asinh :acosh :atanh
   368â†’                               :exp :log :log10 :pow :sqrt))
   369â†’  :postcondition (not (null (clysm/ffi:lookup-foreign-function
   370â†’                              clysm/ffi:*ffi-environment* name))))
   371â†’
   372â†’(defcontract type-coercion (value target-type)
   373â†’  "Coerce VALUE to TARGET-TYPE for numeric operations.
   374â†’   FR-035: System MUST handle type coercion appropriately (integers to floats for transcendental functions)."
   375â†’  :precondition (numberp value)
   376â†’  :postcondition (typep result target-type)
   377â†’  :examples
   378â†’  ((type-coercion 5 'float) => 5.0)
   379â†’  ((type-coercion 3/4 'float) => 0.75))
   380â†’

;;;; numeric-api.lisp - API Contracts for ANSI Numeric Functions
;;;; Feature: 001-ansi-numeric-functions
;;;; Date: 2025-12-29

(in-package #:clysm/contracts/numeric)

;;; ============================================================
;;; Trigonometric Functions (FR-001 to FR-006)
;;; ============================================================

(defcontract sin (x)
  "Compute the sine of X (in radians).
   FR-001: System MUST implement sin accepting a real number and returning the sine as a float."
  :precondition (realp x)
  :postcondition (floatp result)
  :examples
  ((sin 0) => 0.0)
  ((sin (/ pi 2)) => 1.0)
  ((sin pi) => 0.0))

(defcontract cos (x)
  "Compute the cosine of X (in radians).
   FR-002: System MUST implement cos accepting a real number and returning the cosine as a float."
  :precondition (realp x)
  :postcondition (floatp result)
  :examples
  ((cos 0) => 1.0)
  ((cos (/ pi 2)) => 0.0)
  ((cos pi) => -1.0))

(defcontract tan (x)
  "Compute the tangent of X (in radians).
   FR-003: System MUST implement tan accepting a real number and returning the tangent as a float."
  :precondition (realp x)
  :postcondition (floatp result)
  :examples
  ((tan 0) => 0.0)
  ((tan (/ pi 4)) => 1.0))

(defcontract asin (x)
  "Compute the arc sine of X, result in radians.
   FR-004: System MUST implement asin accepting a number in [-1, 1] and returning the arc sine in radians.
   For |x| > 1, returns complex result per ANSI CL."
  :precondition (numberp x)
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((asin 0) => 0.0)
  ((asin 1) => (/ pi 2))
  ((asin 2) => #C(1.5707963... 1.316957...)))

(defcontract acos (x)
  "Compute the arc cosine of X, result in radians.
   FR-005: System MUST implement acos accepting a number in [-1, 1] and returning the arc cosine in radians.
   For |x| > 1, returns complex result per ANSI CL."
  :precondition (numberp x)
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((acos 1) => 0.0)
  ((acos 0) => (/ pi 2))
  ((acos -1) => pi))

(defcontract atan (y &optional x)
  "Compute the arc tangent.
   FR-006: System MUST implement atan accepting one or two arguments and returning the arc tangent in radians.
   With one arg: atan(y).
   With two args: atan2(y, x) for correct quadrant."
  :precondition (and (realp y) (or (null x) (realp x)))
  :postcondition (floatp result)
  :examples
  ((atan 0) => 0.0)
  ((atan 1) => (/ pi 4))
  ((atan 1 1) => (/ pi 4))
  ((atan 1 -1) => (* 3 (/ pi 4))))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Hyperbolic Functions (FR-007 to FR-012)
;;; ============================================================

(defcontract sinh (x)
  "Compute the hyperbolic sine of X.
   FR-007: System MUST implement sinh accepting a real number and returning the hyperbolic sine."
  :precondition (realp x)
  :postcondition (floatp result)
  :examples
  ((sinh 0) => 0.0))

(defcontract cosh (x)
  "Compute the hyperbolic cosine of X.
   FR-008: System MUST implement cosh accepting a real number and returning the hyperbolic cosine."
  :precondition (realp x)
  :postcondition (floatp result)
  :examples
  ((cosh 0) => 1.0))

(defcontract tanh (x)
  "Compute the hyperbolic tangent of X.
   FR-009: System MUST implement tanh accepting a real number and returning the hyperbolic tangent."
  :precondition (realp x)
  :postcondition (floatp result)
  :examples
  ((tanh 0) => 0.0))

(defcontract asinh (x)
  "Compute the inverse hyperbolic sine of X.
   FR-010: System MUST implement asinh accepting a real number and returning the inverse hyperbolic sine."
  :precondition (realp x)
  :postcondition (floatp result)
  :examples
  ((asinh 0) => 0.0))

(defcontract acosh (x)
  "Compute the inverse hyperbolic cosine of X.
   FR-011: System MUST implement acosh accepting a number >= 1 and returning the inverse hyperbolic cosine.
   For x < 1, returns complex result."
  :precondition (numberp x)
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((acosh 1) => 0.0))

(defcontract atanh (x)
  "Compute the inverse hyperbolic tangent of X.
   FR-012: System MUST implement atanh accepting a number in (-1, 1) and returning the inverse hyperbolic tangent.
   For |x| >= 1, returns complex result."
  :precondition (numberp x)
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((atanh 0) => 0.0))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Bitwise Operations (FR-013 to FR-018)
;;; ============================================================

(defcontract ash (integer count)
  "Arithmetic shift INTEGER by COUNT bits.
   FR-013: System MUST implement ash accepting an integer and shift count, returning the arithmetic-shifted result.
   Positive count: shift left. Negative count: shift right (sign-extending)."
  :precondition (and (integerp integer) (integerp count))
  :postcondition (integerp result)
  :examples
  ((ash 1 4) => 16)
  ((ash 16 -2) => 4)
  ((ash -16 -2) => -4))

(defcontract logand (&rest integers)
  "Bitwise AND of INTEGERS.
   FR-014: System MUST implement logand accepting zero or more integers, returning the bitwise AND (identity -1 for no args)."
  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
  :postcondition (integerp result)
  :examples
  ((logand) => -1)
  ((logand #b1100 #b1010) => #b1000)
  ((logand #xFFFF #x0F0F) => #x0F0F))

(defcontract logior (&rest integers)
  "Bitwise inclusive OR of INTEGERS.
   FR-015: System MUST implement logior accepting zero or more integers, returning the bitwise inclusive OR (identity 0 for no args)."
  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
  :postcondition (integerp result)
  :examples
  ((logior) => 0)
  ((logior #b1100 #b1010) => #b1110)
  ((logior #x0F00 #x00F0) => #x0FF0))

(defcontract logxor (&rest integers)
  "Bitwise exclusive OR of INTEGERS.
   FR-016: System MUST implement logxor accepting zero or more integers, returning the bitwise exclusive OR (identity 0 for no args)."
  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
  :postcondition (integerp result)
  :examples
  ((logxor) => 0)
  ((logxor #b1100 #b1010) => #b0110)
  ((logxor #xFFFF #x0F0F) => #xF0F0))

(defcontract lognot (integer)
  "Bitwise complement of INTEGER.
   FR-017: System MUST implement lognot accepting an integer, returning the bitwise complement."
  :precondition (integerp integer)
  :postcondition (integerp result)
  :examples
  ((lognot 0) => -1)
  ((lognot -1) => 0)
  ((lognot #b0101) => #b...11111010))

(defcontract logcount (integer)
  "Count bits in INTEGER.
   FR-018: System MUST implement logcount accepting an integer, returning the count of 1-bits (positive) or 0-bits (negative)."
  :precondition (integerp integer)
  :postcondition (and (integerp result) (>= result 0))
  :examples
  ((logcount 0) => 0)
  ((logcount #b1011) => 3)
  ((logcount 255) => 8)
  ((logcount -1) => 0))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Complex Number Operations (FR-019 to FR-023)
;;; ============================================================

(defcontract complex (realpart &optional (imagpart 0))
  "Create a complex number.
   FR-019: System MUST implement complex accepting two real numbers and returning a complex number."
  :precondition (and (realp realpart) (realp imagpart))
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((complex 3 4) => #C(3 4))
  ((complex 5) => 5)
  ((complex 0 1) => #C(0 1)))

(defcontract realpart (number)
  "Extract the real part of NUMBER.
   FR-020: System MUST implement realpart accepting a number and returning the real component."
  :precondition (numberp number)
  :postcondition (realp result)
  :examples
  ((realpart #C(3 4)) => 3)
  ((realpart 5) => 5)
  ((realpart 3.5) => 3.5))

(defcontract imagpart (number)
  "Extract the imaginary part of NUMBER.
   FR-021: System MUST implement imagpart accepting a number and returning the imaginary component (0 for reals)."
  :precondition (numberp number)
  :postcondition (realp result)
  :examples
  ((imagpart #C(3 4)) => 4)
  ((imagpart 5) => 0)
  ((imagpart 3.5) => 0))

(defcontract conjugate (number)
  "Return the complex conjugate of NUMBER.
   FR-022: System MUST implement conjugate accepting a number and returning the complex conjugate."
  :precondition (numberp number)
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((conjugate #C(3 4)) => #C(3 -4))
  ((conjugate 5) => 5)
  ((conjugate #C(0 1)) => #C(0 -1)))

(defcontract phase (number)
  "Return the phase angle of NUMBER in radians.
   FR-023: System MUST implement phase accepting a number and returning the angle in radians."
  :precondition (numberp number)
  :postcondition (floatp result)
  :examples
  ((phase 1) => 0.0)
  ((phase -1) => pi)
  ((phase #C(0 1)) => (/ pi 2))
  ((phase #C(1 1)) => (/ pi 4)))

;;; ============================================================
;;; Mathematical Functions (FR-024 to FR-033)
;;; ============================================================

(defcontract exp (number)
  "Compute e raised to the power NUMBER.
   FR-024: System MUST implement exp accepting a number and returning e raised to that power."
  :precondition (numberp number)
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((exp 0) => 1.0)
  ((exp 1) => 2.718281828...))

(defcontract log (number &optional base)
  "Compute the logarithm of NUMBER.
   FR-025: System MUST implement log accepting one or two arguments (number and optional base), returning the logarithm."
  :precondition (and (numberp number) (or (null base) (realp base)))
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((log 1) => 0.0)
  ((log (exp 1)) => 1.0)
  ((log 100 10) => 2.0)
  ((log -1) => #C(0 pi)))

(defcontract sqrt (number)
  "Compute the principal square root of NUMBER.
   FR-026: System MUST implement sqrt accepting a number and returning the principal square root."
  :precondition (numberp number)
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((sqrt 4) => 2.0)
  ((sqrt 2) => 1.4142135...)
  ((sqrt -1) => #C(0 1)))

(defcontract expt (base power)
  "Compute BASE raised to the POWER.
   FR-027: System MUST implement expt accepting a base and exponent, returning the power."
  :precondition (and (numberp base) (numberp power))
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((expt 2 10) => 1024)
  ((expt 2 0.5) => 1.4142135...)
  ((expt 0 0) => 1))

(defcontract abs (number)
  "Compute the absolute value (magnitude for complex) of NUMBER.
   FR-028: System MUST implement abs accepting a number and returning the absolute value."
  :precondition (numberp number)
  :postcondition (and (realp result) (>= result 0))
  :examples
  ((abs 5) => 5)
  ((abs -5) => 5)
  ((abs -3.5) => 3.5)
  ((abs #C(3 4)) => 5.0))

(defcontract signum (number)
  "Return the sign indicator of NUMBER.
   FR-029: System MUST implement signum accepting a number and returning the sign indicator."
  :precondition (numberp number)
  :postcondition (numberp result)
  :examples
  ((signum 5) => 1)
  ((signum -5) => -1)
  ((signum 0) => 0)
  ((signum 3.5) => 1.0)
  ((signum #C(3 4)) => #C(0.6 0.8)))

(defcontract max (&rest reals)
  "Return the largest of REALS.
   FR-030: System MUST implement max accepting one or more real numbers, returning the largest."
  :precondition (and (>= (length reals) 1) (every #'realp reals))
  :postcondition (realp result)
  :examples
  ((max 1 2 3) => 3)
  ((max -5 -3 -7) => -3)
  ((max 1.5 2 0.5) => 2))

(defcontract min (&rest reals)
  "Return the smallest of REALS.
   FR-031: System MUST implement min accepting one or more real numbers, returning the smallest."
  :precondition (and (>= (length reals) 1) (every #'realp reals))
  :postcondition (realp result)
  :examples
  ((min 1 2 3) => 1)
  ((min -5 -3 -7) => -7)
  ((min 1.5 2 0.5) => 0.5))

(defcontract gcd (&rest integers)
  "Compute the greatest common divisor of INTEGERS.
   FR-032: System MUST implement gcd accepting zero or more non-negative integers, returning the GCD."
  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
  :postcondition (and (integerp result) (>= result 0))
  :examples
  ((gcd) => 0)
  ((gcd 48 18) => 6)
  ((gcd 12 18 24) => 6)
  ((gcd 0 5) => 5))

(defcontract lcm (&rest integers)
  "Compute the least common multiple of INTEGERS.
   FR-033: System MUST implement lcm accepting zero or more non-negative integers, returning the LCM."
  :precondition (every #'integerp integers)
  :postcondition (and (integerp result) (>= result 0))
  :examples
  ((lcm) => 1)
  ((lcm 4 6) => 12)
  ((lcm 2 3 4) => 12)
  ((lcm 0 5) => 0))

;;; ============================================================
;;; FFI Integration (FR-034 to FR-035)
;;; ============================================================

(defcontract ffi-math-import (name)
  "Ensure math function is imported via FFI.
   FR-034: System MUST utilize Wasm imports (via host FFI) for standard math operations."
  :precondition (member name '(:sin :cos :tan :asin :acos :atan :atan2
                               :sinh :cosh :tanh :asinh :acosh :atanh
                               :exp :log :log10 :pow :sqrt))
  :postcondition (not (null (clysm/ffi:lookup-foreign-function
                              clysm/ffi:*ffi-environment* name))))

(defcontract type-coercion (value target-type)
  "Coerce VALUE to TARGET-TYPE for numeric operations.
   FR-035: System MUST handle type coercion appropriately (integers to floats for transcendental functions)."
  :precondition (numberp value)
  :postcondition (typep result target-type)
  :examples
  ((type-coercion 5 'float) => 5.0)
  ((type-coercion 3/4 'float) => 0.75))
